source_sentence: 佛說波斯匿王太后崩塵土
translation: The Buddha said that the Queen of Prasenajit was disintegrating into dust

source_sentence: 坌身經
translation: Sutra on Body Embodiment

source_sentence: 西晉沙門法炬譯
translation: Western Jin Dynasty Translation of the Lotus Sutra

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在舍衛城祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，拘娑羅國波斯匿王太后崩，時年百歲老無壯勢，精進修善法。
translation: At the time, the queen mother of the king of Kośala Prasenajit was a hundred years old and had no strength, and she was diligently cultivating good qualities.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王供殯送母，日正中還，塵土坌身步往詣園至世尊所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: When King Prasenajit returned from a funeral service for his mother in the middle of the sun, he walked up to the park with his body covered in dust and went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head and feet, and sat down at one side.

source_sentence: 時，世尊問王言：「今王何故塵土坌身步來至我所？」
translation: The Bhagavān then asked the king, "Why did the king come to me with dust and dirt on his body?"

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王便涕泣不能自勝，揮淚白世尊言：「太后崩，世尊！
translation: Then, King Prasenajit weeping uncontrollably, he burst into tears and said to the Bhagavān, "The Empress is dead, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 太后無常，如來！
translation: The Empress is impermanent, Tathāgata!

source_sentence: 年在期頤無少壯力，積修善法甚戀痛念，夙夜孝養未曾違志，命可贖者世殞身壽。
translation: "When she was in her prime, she had no little strength, accumulated good qualities, longed for painful thoughts, and was filially nurturing from night to night without ever disagreeing with her intention; those whose lives could be redeemed would die in the world.

source_sentence: 若象馬車乘贖命可得者，盡當持贖；以人民眾贖命可得者，亦當持贖；莫使我母命過。
translation: If it's possible to redeem the life of an elephant, horse, or chariot, you must atone for it; if it's possible to redeem the life of a large group of people, you must also atone for it; don't let my mother's life pass.

source_sentence: 若以金銀贖命可得者，亦當持贖；若以珍寶贖命可得者，亦當持贖；若以金銀珍寶贖命可得者，亦當持金銀珍寶贖命；若以奴贖命可得者，亦當持奴贖命；若以婢贖命可得者，亦當持婢贖命；若以奴婢贖命可得者，亦當持奴婢贖命；若以村落贖命可得者，亦當以村落贖命；若以城廓贖命可得者，亦當以城廓贖命；若以村落城廓贖命可得者，亦當以城廓村落贖命；若以一方贖命可得者，亦當以一方贖命；若以地人民贖命可得者，亦當以地人民贖命；若以人民一方贖命可得者，亦當以人民一方贖命；莫使我母命過。」
translation: 若以金銀贖命可得者，亦當持贖；若以珍寶贖命可得者，亦當持贖；若以金銀珍寶贖命可得者，亦當持金銀珍寶贖命；若以奴贖命可得者，亦當持奴贖命；若以婢贖命可得者，亦當持婢贖命；若以奴婢贖命可得者，亦當持奴婢贖命；若以村落贖命可得者，亦當以村落贖命；若以城廓贖命可得者，亦當以城廓贖命；若以村落城廓贖命可得者，亦當以城廓村落贖命；若以一方贖命可得者，亦當以一方贖命；若以地人民贖命可得者，亦當以地人民贖命；若以人民一方贖命可得者，亦當以人民一方贖命；莫使我母命過。」

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告波斯匿王言：「如是，大王！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed King Prasenajit, "So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 如王所說，若以白象贖命可得者，便可以象贖母命，若以馬車、人民、珍寶金銀、奴婢、村落、城廓、一方人民贖母命可得者，便當以一方人民贖母命，莫使我母命過。
translation: As the king has said, if it's possible to redeem the life of a white elephant, then you can redeem the life of your mother with an elephant; if it's possible to redeem the life of your mother with a horse and cart, people, precious metals and silver, slaves and maids, a village, a town, or one side of the people, then you can redeem the life of your mother with one side of the people; don't let my mother's life pass you by.

source_sentence: 是故，大王！
translation: Therefore, Great King!

source_sentence: 當思惟無常想，當廣布無常想，當廣布死想。」
translation: You must contemplate impermanence, you must disseminate the contemplation of impermanence, and you must disseminate the contemplation of death."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊便說偈言：「一切人歸死，　　無有不死者，　隨行種殃福，　　自獲善惡果。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "All people return to death, and there's no one who doesn't die, who practices various kinds of evil and merit and obtains the results of good and evil on their own.

source_sentence: 地獄為惡行，　　善者必生天，　明慧能分別，　　唯福能遏惡。
translation: Evil deeds are done in hell, but the good are born in heaven; insight discerns them, and only goodness can keep evil at bay.

source_sentence: 「如是，大王！
translation: "So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 有四恐畏、大恐畏，無能避者，亦不可以力刀杖避，呪術、藥草、象馬車乘、人民、珍寶金銀、奴婢、村落城廓、一方人民，珍寶金銀、奴婢、村落城廓、一方人民。
translation: "There are four fears and great fears that can't be avoided, nor can they be avoided with strength, swords, spells, medicinal herbs, elephants, horses, chariots, people, treasures, gold, and silver, slaves, villages, mansions, and people on one side, and treasures, gold, silver, slaves, villages, mansions, and people on one side.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 老為大恐畏，肌肉消盡，不可以刀杖避，乃至一方人民皆無能避；病為大恐畏，無強健志，不可以刀杖避，乃至一方人民；死為大恐畏，盡無有壽，不可以刀杖避，乃至一方人民；恩愛別離為大恐畏，不可以刀杖避，乃至一方人民。
translation: "It's a great fear to grow old and lose your muscles, so you can't be avoided with a knife or stick, even if none of the people in the area can avoid it; it's a great fear to become ill and lack a strong will, so you can't be avoided with a knife or stick, even if the people in the area; it's a great fear to die and lose your life span, so you can't be avoided with a knife or stick, even if the people in the area; and it's a great fear to be separated from your loved ones, so you can't be avoided with a knife or stick, even if the people in the area.

source_sentence: 是謂，大王！
translation: This is called, "Great King!

source_sentence: 有此四大恐畏，不可以刀杖避，呪術、藥草、象馬車乘、人民，珍寶金銀、奴婢、村落城廓、一方人民，珍寶金銀、奴婢、村落城廓、一方人民。
translation: There are these four great fears that prevent them from avoiding a sword, a spell, medicinal herbs, elephants, horses, chariots, people, precious metals and silver, slaves, villages, towns, and people on one side, and precious metals and silver, slaves, villages, towns, and people on one side.

source_sentence: 譬如，大王！
translation: For example, great king!

source_sentence: 有大雲起雷電霹靂，斯須還散亦不久停。
translation: A great cloud arises, thunderbolts thunder, and these must be returned and scattered, and they won't stop for long.

source_sentence: 如是，大王！
translation: Thus, Great King!

source_sentence: 人命極短壽極百歲，其中出者亦少少耳。
translation: "A person's life is extremely short, and his life span is an extremely long hundred years, but few of them will emerge.

source_sentence: 譬如，大王！
translation: For example, my lord!

source_sentence: 有四大山石無有空缺，四山皆等一時相磨，樹木藥草不可以刀杖避。
translation: There are four large mountains with no vacancies in rocks, four mountains that are all ground equally at the same time, and trees and medicinal plants that can't be avoided with a sword or stick.

source_sentence: 如是，大王！
translation: Thus, great king!

source_sentence: 有四大恐畏至，不可得避。
translation: There are four major fears that arrive and can't be avoided.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 老為大患，肌肉消盡，不可以刀杖避，藥草呪術而得避者；病為大患，無強健志；死為大患，身永滅；恩愛別離為大患，不可以刀杖避，呪術、藥草而得避者。
translation: Old age is a major danger; it's the disappearance of muscles, which can't be avoided with a sword or a spell; illness is a major danger; it's the lack of a strong will; death is a major danger; it's the permanent disappearance of the body; and separation from lovers is a major danger; it can't be avoided with a sword or a spell or a herb.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 廣修無常想，廣布無常想。
translation: "They'll widely cultivate the contemplation of impermanence and widely disseminate the contemplation of impermanence.

source_sentence: 所以然者，已修無常想，當布無常想，盡斷一切欲愛，盡斷一切色愛，盡斷一切無色愛，一切無明盡斷，此間所有愛亦斷。
translation: That's why, once they cultivate the contemplation of impermanence and will spread the contemplation of impermanence, they'll end all craving, end all craving for form, end all craving for formlessness, end all ignorance, and end all craving in the interim.

source_sentence: 譬如，大王！
translation: Such is the case, great king!

source_sentence: 草[葶-丁+呆]積薪積以火往燒，大叢林、若臺閣舍，此亦如是。
translation: It's the same as straw [scape - ding + dull] that's accumulated as firewood and burned, or it's the same as a large forest or a dais or mansion.

source_sentence: 若修無常想，廣布無常想，盡斷欲愛，盡斷色愛，盡斷無色愛，盡斷無明，盡斷此間所有愛。
translation: If someone cultivates the contemplation of impermanence and disseminates the contemplation of impermanence, they'll end craving, end form craving, end formless craving, end ignorance, and end all craving in this world.

source_sentence: 是故，大王！
translation: Therefore, Great King!

source_sentence: 當以正法治化，莫以非法治化。
translation: You must teach by right and teach by wrong.

source_sentence: 如是，大王！
translation: So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 當作是學。」
translation: Train yourselves in this way."

source_sentence: 爾時，波斯匿王白世尊言：「此法名何等？
translation: It was then that King Prasenajit said to the Bhagavān, "What's the name of this teaching?

source_sentence: 當云何奉持？」
translation: How will you uphold it?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「名除憂患經，此法除去憂患。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "It's called the Sutra on Eliminating Sorrows, and this teaching removes sorrow and distress."

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王白世尊言：「如是，世尊！
translation: King Prasenajit then said to the Bhagavān, "So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 除憂患經，如是，世尊！
translation: "Thus, Bhagavān, is the Sutra on Eliminating Sorrow and Distress!

source_sentence: 除憂患經。
translation: "The Sutra on Eliminating Sorrow and Distress.

source_sentence: 所以然者，我聞此法已，世尊！
translation: That's why, Bhagavān, I've heard this teaching!

source_sentence: 所有戀慕愁憂皆悉除盡，自覺身體柔軟歡喜。」
translation: All longing and sadness are completely removed, and I feel my body become supple and joyous."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊與王波斯匿，具說微妙法勸令歡喜。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke to King Prasenajit, explaining the subtle Dharma and encouraging him to rejoice.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王即從坐起，頭面禮足繞佛三匝而去。
translation: King Prasenajit then rose from his seat, bowed his head and feet, circled the Buddha three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，拘娑羅國波斯匿王，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: At the time, King Prasenajit of Kośala heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: 佛說波斯匿王太后崩塵土坌身經
translation: Sutra on the Queen of Prasenajit's Collapsing Body of Dust
